question.title: Swagger for a spring boot application shows placeholder instead of Project name, version etc
question.body:
Swagger for my spring boot application shows placeholders instead of actual values like

@project.name@ , @project.version@

@project.description@

@{operation.tag} POST / ${operation.desc}

File: application.properties

info.app.artifact=@project.artifactId@
info.app.name=@project.name@
info.app.description=@project.description@
info.app.version=@project.version@

File: api-documentation.properties

operation.tag=Operation_Name
operation.desc=This operation is to retrieve records from database.

File: pom.xml contains:

...............
...............
<artifactId>my-project</artifactId>
<version>${major.number}.${minor.number}.${build.number}-${tag}</version>
<name>my-project</name>
...............
...............

I have tried the following 3 things:

1.Ensure that filtering is enabled for the application.properties file in the pom.xml:

............
<build>
    <resources>
        <resource>
            <directory>src/main/resources</directory>
            <filtering>true</filtering>
        </resource>
    </resources>
</build>
............

2.Define Placeholders in pom.xml: Verify that the placeholders are defined in the section of the pom.xml:

<properties>
        <project.name>My Project Name</project.name>
        <project.description>Spring boot based project to test swagger</project.description>
        <project.version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</project.version> 
    </properties>

3.Configure Maven Resources Plugin: Ensure the maven-resources-plugin is configured to use @ as the delimiter for placeholders:

<build>
    <plugins>
        <plugin>
            <artifactId>maven-resources-plugin</artifactId>
            <version>3.2.0</version>
            <configuration>
                <delimiters>
                    <delimiter>@</delimiter>
                </delimiters>
                <useDefaultDelimiters>false</useDefaultDelimiters>
            </configuration>
        </plugin>
    </plugins> 
</build>

but nothing worked. Any suggestions please?

answers.body:
Removing the resources tags fixed the issue. Swagger UI now shows the Project name, version and description instead of placeholders.

Commented out the resources tags in pom.xml as below.

<build>
    <!--<resources>
        <resource>
            <directory>src/main/resources</directory>
            <filtering>true</filtering>
        </resource>
    </resources>-->
    <plugins>
        <plugin>
            <artifactId>maven-enforcer-plugin</artifactId>
        </plugin>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        </plugin>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>com.googlecode.maven-download-plugin</groupId>
            <artifactId>download-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        </plugin>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
            <artifactId>maven-pmd-plugin</artifactId>
        </plugin>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>org.jacoco</groupId>
            <artifactId>jacoco-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        </plugin>
    </plugins>
</build>

Spring Boot’s Maven plugin can generate a META-INF/build-info.properties containing your project.name, project.version, etc. You define them to your pom.xml

Here is the code snippet shown below

<build>
  <plugins>
    <plugin>
      <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
      <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
      <executions>
        <execution>
          <goals>
            <goal>build-info</goal>
          </goals>
        </execution>
      </executions>
      <configuration>
        <additionalProperties>
          <info.app.name>${project.name}</info.app.name>
          <info.app.version>${project.version}</info.app.version>
          <info.app.description>${project.description}</info.app.description>
        </additionalProperties>
      </configuration>
    </plugin>
  </plugins>
</build>

Spring Boot will expose those under the info prefix at runtime.

I hope it can help you fix your issue.

question_comments.body: tried it already, didn't work. removing the resources block entirely from build tags fixed the issue. Will add it as an answer, just in case this is the issue for someone else also.
Try running maven in your terminal for your project then refresh it on IJ
are you building your project with maven or on an IDE?

79615963.body: added this plugin to the pom.xml but it didn't work. Swagger still shows placeholders instead of actual values.
